trans-unit.source: How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template
trans-unit.target: How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template

trans-unit.source: You can use the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) for Windows 8 to create your own driver tests or to customize some of the tests that are provided.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) for Windows 8 to create your own driver tests or to customize some of the tests that are provided.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy the tests that you create to remote test computers using the driver testing framework that the WDK provides for Microsoft Visual Studio Ultimate 2012.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy the tests that you create to remote test computers using the driver testing framework that the WDK provides for Microsoft Visual Studio Ultimate 2012.

trans-unit.source: The WDK provides templates that create starter code for a Windows Driver test project in C++, C\#, and Script (JScript).
trans-unit.target: The WDK provides templates that create starter code for a Windows Driver test project in C++, C\#, and Script (JScript).

trans-unit.source: You can select the test cases that you want to include, or you can start with a blank project.
trans-unit.target: You can select the test cases that you want to include, or you can start with a blank project.

trans-unit.source: You can customize the code to add new test cases for your driver.
trans-unit.target: You can customize the code to add new test cases for your driver.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy your tests from Visual Studio using the driver test framework.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy your tests from Visual Studio using the driver test framework.

trans-unit.source: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for C++
trans-unit.target: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for C++

trans-unit.source: From the **File** menu, click **New > Project**.
trans-unit.target: From the **File** menu, click **New > Project**.

trans-unit.source: From the list of installed templates in the **New Project** dialog box, select **Visual C++ > Windows Driver > Tests**.
trans-unit.target: From the list of installed templates in the **New Project** dialog box, select **Visual C++ > Windows Driver > Tests**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Windows Driver Test in C++**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Windows Driver Test in C++**.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).

trans-unit.source: From the **Windows Driver Test** dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.
trans-unit.target: From the **Windows Driver Test** dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the test cases, see [Windows Driver test cases](#windows_driver_test_cases).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the test cases, see [Windows Driver test cases](#windows_driver_test_cases).

trans-unit.source: Add the required test metadata.
trans-unit.target: Add the required test metadata.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to add test metadata](to_add_test_metadata.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to add test metadata](to_add_test_metadata.md).

trans-unit.source: Build your driver test.
trans-unit.target: Build your driver test.

trans-unit.source: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for C
trans-unit.target: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for C

trans-unit.source: From the **File** menu, click **New > Project**.
trans-unit.target: From the **File** menu, click **New > Project**.

trans-unit.source: From the list of installed templates in the **New Project** dialog box, select **Visual C\# > Windows Driver** .
trans-unit.target: From the list of installed templates in the **New Project** dialog box, select **Visual C\# > Windows Driver** .

trans-unit.source: Select **Windows Driver Test in C\#**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Windows Driver Test in C\#**.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).

trans-unit.source: From the **Windows Driver Test** dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.
trans-unit.target: From the **Windows Driver Test** dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.

trans-unit.source: For information about the test cases, see [Windows Driver test cases](#windows_driver_test_cases).
trans-unit.target: For information about the test cases, see [Windows Driver test cases](#windows_driver_test_cases).

trans-unit.source: Add the required test metadata.
trans-unit.target: Add the required test metadata.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to add test metadata](to_add_test_metadata.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to add test metadata](to_add_test_metadata.md).

trans-unit.source: Build your driver test.
trans-unit.target: Build your driver test.

trans-unit.source: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for Script
trans-unit.target: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for Script

trans-unit.source: From the **File** menu, click **New > Project**.
trans-unit.target: From the **File** menu, click **New > Project**.

trans-unit.source: From the list of installed templates in the **New Project** dialog box, select **Script > Windows Driver** .
trans-unit.target: From the list of installed templates in the **New Project** dialog box, select **Script > Windows Driver** .

trans-unit.source: Select **Windows Driver Test Script**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Windows Driver Test Script**.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).

trans-unit.source: From the **Windows Driver Test** dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.
trans-unit.target: From the **Windows Driver Test** dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.

trans-unit.source: For information about the test cases, see [Windows Driver test cases](#windows_driver_test_cases).
trans-unit.target: For information about the test cases, see [Windows Driver test cases](#windows_driver_test_cases).

trans-unit.source: Add the required test metadata.
trans-unit.target: Add the required test metadata.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to add test metadata](to_add_test_metadata.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to add test metadata](to_add_test_metadata.md).

trans-unit.source: Build your driver test.
trans-unit.target: Build your driver test.

trans-unit.source: Making the driver tests you create available for deployment on test computers
trans-unit.target: Making the driver tests you create available for deployment on test computers

trans-unit.source: When you build your driver test, the new test will be available for deployment to a test computer.
trans-unit.target: When you build your driver test, the new test will be available for deployment to a test computer.

trans-unit.source: By default, the tests that you create will appear in the test category **My Test Category**.
trans-unit.target: By default, the tests that you create will appear in the test category **My Test Category**.

trans-unit.source: The names of the tests are based upon the test cases that you choose, and they will have names such as **My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test**.
trans-unit.target: The names of the tests are based upon the test cases that you choose, and they will have names such as **My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test**.

trans-unit.source: During each build of the test, the test will be overwritten.
trans-unit.target: During each build of the test, the test will be overwritten.

trans-unit.source: The latest build of the test will be available to deploy and run on the test computer.
trans-unit.target: The latest build of the test will be available to deploy and run on the test computer.

trans-unit.source: Windows Driver test cases
trans-unit.target: Windows Driver test cases

trans-unit.source: The WDK provides starter code for a Windows Driver test project in C++, C\#, and Script.
trans-unit.target: The WDK provides starter code for a Windows Driver test project in C++, C\#, and Script.

trans-unit.source: You can select test cases that you want to include, or you can start with a blank project.
trans-unit.target: You can select test cases that you want to include, or you can start with a blank project.

trans-unit.source: Not all test cases are available in every language.
trans-unit.target: Not all test cases are available in every language.

trans-unit.source: Plug and Play Test Cases
trans-unit.target: Plug and Play Test Cases

trans-unit.source: Test cases that force a driver to handle most of the Plug and Play (PnP)-related IRPs
trans-unit.target: Test cases that force a driver to handle most of the Plug and Play (PnP)-related IRPs

trans-unit.source: Disable/Enable
trans-unit.target: Disable/Enable

trans-unit.source: Provides code for test cases that disable and enable a PnP device.
trans-unit.target: Provides code for test cases that disable and enable a PnP device.

trans-unit.source: Remove
trans-unit.target: Remove

trans-unit.source: Provides code for test cases that remove a PnP device.
trans-unit.target: Provides code for test cases that remove a PnP device.

trans-unit.source: Surprise Remove
trans-unit.target: Surprise Remove

trans-unit.source: Provides code for test cases that perform a surprise remove of a PnP device.
trans-unit.target: Provides code for test cases that perform a surprise remove of a PnP device.

trans-unit.source: Power Management Test Cases
trans-unit.target: Power Management Test Cases

trans-unit.source: Provides test cases that force a driver to handle system sleep states.
trans-unit.target: Provides test cases that force a driver to handle system sleep states.

trans-unit.source: System Sleep States
trans-unit.target: System Sleep States

trans-unit.source: Provides code for test cases that perform device I/O while the system cycles through sleep and power state.
trans-unit.target: Provides code for test cases that perform device I/O while the system cycles through sleep and power state.

trans-unit.source: Stress and Functionality Test Cases
trans-unit.target: Stress and Functionality Test Cases

trans-unit.source: Provides test cases that perform I/O stress and function testing of IOCTL and WMI interfaces.
trans-unit.target: Provides test cases that perform I/O stress and function testing of IOCTL and WMI interfaces.

trans-unit.source: I/O Stress
trans-unit.target: I/O Stress

trans-unit.source: Provides test cases that perform device I/O stress.
trans-unit.target: Provides test cases that perform device I/O stress.

trans-unit.source: Functional IOCTL Interface
trans-unit.target: Functional IOCTL Interface

trans-unit.source: Provides a template for creating functional test cases for the IOCTL interface.
trans-unit.target: Provides a template for creating functional test cases for the IOCTL interface.

trans-unit.source: (only available for C++ ).
trans-unit.target: (only available for C++ ).

trans-unit.source: Functional WMI Interface
trans-unit.target: Functional WMI Interface

trans-unit.source: Provides a template for creating functional test cases for the Windows Management Interface (WMI).
trans-unit.target: Provides a template for creating functional test cases for the Windows Management Interface (WMI).

trans-unit.source: (only available in Script)
trans-unit.target: (only available in Script)

trans-unit.source: Empty Test Case
trans-unit.target: Empty Test Case

trans-unit.source: Provides a blank template for creating a Windows Driver test project.
trans-unit.target: Provides a blank template for creating a Windows Driver test project.

trans-unit.target: Related topics

trans-unit.target: Test Authoring and Execution Framework
